intro: Randia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan randia, is a flowering plant species native to China, specifically the Hainan Island. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pink flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Randia hainanensis is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
